thread.title: ALCS: Kansas City on verge of return trip to World Series - Baseball
thread.title_full: ALCS: Kansas City on verge of return trip to World Series - Baseball - NorthJersey.com

author: HOWIE RUMBERG
title: ALCS: Kansas City on verge of return trip to World Series - Baseball
text:
Buy this photo TORONTO — Ben Zobrist and the relentless Royals showed they can play home run derby, too. And with one more win, they'll have a chance to show off their power in a return trip to the World Series.
Zobrist hit a two-run homer on knuckleballer R.A. Dickey's fourth pitch of the game and Alex Rios connected an inning later as Kansas City romped past Toronto, 14-2, Tuesday for a 3-1 lead in the ALCS.
Buy this photo Lorenzo Cain scored on a passed ball and Mike Moustakas had a sacrifice fly in a four-run top of the first — a league championship series record.
"We're a good offensive team, Eric Hosmer said. 
Buy this photo "Our park, our style of play is a little different. We like to use our legs and be athletic, but when we come to some of these parks where the fences aren't as deep, we've got some guys that can put the ball in the seats."
Alcides Escobar had four RBI and Cain drove in three runs as the Royals bounced back from an 11-8 loss Monday. Kansas City led, 5-2, in the seventh Tuesday before breaking away.
Buy this photo Blue Jays infielder Cliff Pennington relieved in the ninth inning, becoming the first primarily position player to pitch in the postseason, according to STATS. Greeted by cheers, he allowed two hits and got one out.
Kansas City can win the pennant today, when Edinson Volquez starts against Toronto's Marco Estrada in a Game 1 rematch.
"It's a do-or-die game for us," Toronto manager John Gibbons said. "But they do it all year. I think these guys will let this one go and they'll show up to play. ... I know these guys will be ready."
After flashing power to build a 5-0 lead on the long ball, the Royals returned to their pesky ways late in the game against the Blue Jays' struggling bullpen.
